---
modules:
  default:
    metrics:
    - name: mcc
      path: "{ .Aggregated_PerSecondStats.Samples }"
      help: Per-second stats aggregated over a minute
      labels:
        environment: test
host=crtsh-postgres port=5432 dbname=certwatch user=certwatch password=certwatch sslmode=disable

# Default DB connection settings
# conninfo to be supplied via the "-conninfo" command-line parameter.
connopen = 2
connidle = 2
connlife = "10m"

# Default workload settings
interval = "30s"
batch = 20
concurrent = 2

# Other default settings
httptimeout = "30s"
host=crtsh-postgres port=5432 dbname=certwatch user=certwatch password=certwatch sslmode=disable

# Default DB connection settings
# conninfo to be supplied via the "-conninfo" command-line parameter.
connopen = 2
connidle = 2
connlife = "10m"

# Default workload settings
interval = "30s"
batch = 500
concurrent = 50

# Other default settings
httptimeout = "30s"
host=crtsh-postgres port=5432 dbname=certwatch user=certwatch password=certwatch sslmode=disable

# Default DB connection settings
# conninfo to be supplied via the "-conninfo" command-line parameter.
connopen = 2
connidle = 2
connlife = "10m"

# Default workload settings
interval = "30s"
batch = 500
concurrent = 50

# Other default settings
httptimeout = "30s"

routers:
- name: Oracle Cloud, Aus East
  network:
    name: oracle-aue
    display_name: oracle-aue
  nos: linux
  address: localhost
  port: 2222
  credential:
    username: ubuntu
    password: ubuntu
  vrfs:
  - name: global
    default: true
    ipv4:
      source_address: 192.0.2.1
    ipv6:
      source_address: 2001:db8::1

- name: TZ
  value: "${TIMEZONE}"
- name: JAVA_OPTS_APPEND
  value: "-Djgroups.dns.query=keycloak-headless"
- name: KC_PROXY
  value: edge
- name: KC_HTTP_ENABLED
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME
  value: id.${DOMAIN_1}
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT_HTTPS
  value: "true"
- name: KC_LOG_LEVEL
  value: "org.keycloak.events:DEBUG,org.infinispan:INFO,org.jgroups:INFO"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_USER}"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASS}"

# - name: QUARKUS_TRANSACTION_MANAGER_ENABLE_RECOVERY
#   value: "true"
# - name: KC_CACHE_STACK
#   value: kubernetes
# - name: KC_DB_USERNAME
#   value: "${POSTGRES_SSO_USERNAME}"
# - name: KC_DB_PASSWORD
#   value: "${POSTGRES_SSO_PASSWORD}"
# - name: KC_DB
#   value: postgres
# - name: KC_DB_URL_HOST
#   value: "postgresql.sso.svc.cluster.local"
# - name: KC_DB_URL_PORT
#   value: "5432"
# - name: KC_DB_URL_DATABASE
#   value: sso
# - name: KC_CACHE
#   value: ispn
# - name: KC_HTTP_RELATIVE_PATH
#   value: /auth
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/tls.crt
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_KEY_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/tls.key
# - name: KC_HTTPS_TRUST_STORE_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/truststore.jks
# - name: KC_HTTPS_TRUST_STORE_PASSWORD
#   value: password
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CLIENT_AUTH
#   value: request

# Could use the above envar, but lets use the quarkus conf file
quarkus.transaction-manager.enable-recovery=true
# quarkus.http.non-application-root-path=/

- name: objectstore
  emptyDir:
    sizeLimit: 100Mi
- name: quarkusproperties
  secret:
    secretName: keycloak-quarkusproperties
    defaultMode: 0777

- mountPath: /ObjectStore
  name: objectstore
- name: quarkusproperties
  mountPath: /opt/keycloak/conf/quarkus.properties
  subPath: quarkus.properties

#!/bin/sh

npm install homebridge-myq
npm install homebridge-nest
npm install homebridge-platform-orbit

bootstrapDns: tcp+udp:1.1.1.1
upstream:
  default:
  #- tcp+udp:2001:67c:1be8::53:1
  #- tcp+udp:1.1.1.1
  - tcp-tls:one.one.one.one
  - tcp-tls:dns.google
conditional:
  mapping:
    lan.${HOME_DOMAIN}: tcp+udp:${GATEWAY_ADDRESS}
    skylab.fi: tcp+udp:${GATEWAY_ADDRESS}
    fh: tcp+udp:fd0d:944c:1337:a::1
blocking:
  blackLists:
    ads:
    - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ookangzheng/dbl-oisd-nl/master/dbl.txt
    windowsSpy:
    - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/crazy-max/WindowsSpyBlocker/master/data/hosts/spy.txt
  whiteLists:
    ads:
    - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/anudeepND/whitelist/master/domains/whitelist.txt
    own:
    - https://gist.githubusercontent.com/samip5/447f880e84601b7c44a659faf1c60669/raw/62170401cd2a43533895266a2e7fcafe24a69362/whitelist.txt
  clientGroupsBlock:
    default:
    - ads
    - windowsSpy
clientLookup:
  upstream: tcp+udp:${GATEWAY_ADDRESS}
caching:
  minTime: 1m
  maxTime: 30m
  prefetching: true
  prefetchExpires: 2h
  prefetchThreshold: 5
  prefetchMaxItemsCount: 0
redis:
  address: redis.databases.svc.cluster.local
  database: 10
  required: false
  connectionAttempts: 10
  connectionCooldown: 30s
prometheus:
  enable: true
  path: /metrics
queryLog:
  type: postgresql
  target: "host=192.168.2.2 user=blocky password=${SECRET_BLOCKY_DB_PASSWORD} dbname=blocky sslmode=disable TimeZone=Europe/Helsinki"
  logRetentionDays: 14
httpPort: 4000

- rule: Detect su or sudo
  desc: detect sudo activities
  condition:
    spawned_process and proc.name in (sudo, su)
  output: >
    Detected sudo or su privilege escalation activity (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline)
  priority: WARNING
  tags: [process]
- rule: Package Management Launched
  desc: detect package management launched
  condition: >
    spawned_process and user.name != "_apt" and package_mgmt_procs and not package_mgmt_ancestor_procs
  output: >
    Package management process launched in container (user=%user.name
    command=%proc.cmdline container_id=%container.id container_name=%container.name image=%container.image.repository:%container.image.tag)
  priority: ERROR
  tags: [process]

- rule: Inbound SSH Connection
  desc: Detect Inbound SSH Connection
  condition: >
    ((evt.type in (accept,listen) and evt.dir=<) or
      (evt.type in (recvfrom,recvmsg))) and ssh_port
  output: >
    Inbound SSH connection (user=%user.name client_ip=%fd.cip client_port=%fd.cport server_ip=%fd.sip)
  priority: WARNING
  tags: [network]
- rule: Outbound SSH Connection
  desc: Detect Outbound SSH Connection
  condition: >
    ((evt.type = connect and evt.dir=<) or
      (evt.type in (sendto,sendmsg))) and ssh_port
  output: >
    Outbound SSH connection (user=%user.name server_ip=%fd.sip server_port=%fd.sport client_ip=%fd.cip)
  priority: WARNING
  tags: [network]

- rule: Detect New File
  desc: detect new file created
  condition: >
    evt.type = chmod or evt.type = fchmod
  output: >
    File below a known directory opened for writing (user=%user.name
    command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name parent=%proc.pname pcmdline=%proc.pcmdline gparent=%proc.aname[2])
  priority: ERROR
  tags: [filesystem]
- rule: Detect New Directory
  desc: detect new directory created
  condition: >
    mkdir
  output: >
    File below a known directory opened for writing (user=%user.name
    command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name parent=%proc.pname pcmdline=%proc.pcmdline gparent=%proc.aname[2])
  priority: ERROR
  tags: [filesystem]
- rule: Detect File Permission or Ownership Change
  desc: detect file permission/ownership change
  condition: >
    spawned_process and proc.name in (chmod, chown) and proc.args contains "/tmp/"
  output: >
    File below a known directory has permission or ownership change (user=%user.name
    command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name parent=%proc.pname pcmdline=%proc.pcmdline gparent=%proc.aname[2])
  priority: WARNING
  tags: [filesystem]
- rule: Detect Directory Change
  desc: detect directories change
  condition: >
    spawned_process and proc.name in (mkdir, rmdir, mvdir, mv)
  output: >
    Directory Change in Filesystem (user=%user.name
    command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name parent=%proc.pname pcmdline=%proc.pcmdline gparent=%proc.aname[2])
  priority: WARNING
  tags: [filesystem]
- rule: Kernel Module Modification
  desc: detect kernel module change
  condition: >
    spawned_process and proc.name in (insmod, modprobe)
  output: >
    Kernel Module Change (user=%user.name
    command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name parent=%proc.pname pcmdline=%proc.pcmdline gparent=%proc.aname[2] result=%evt.res)
  priority: WARNING
  tags: [process]
- rule: Node Created in Filesystem
  desc: detect node created in filesystem
  condition: >
    spawned_process and proc.name = mknod
  output: >
    Node Creation in Filesystem (user=%user.name
    command=%proc.cmdline file=%fd.name parent=%proc.pname pcmdline=%proc.pcmdline gparent=%proc.aname[2] result=%evt.res)
  priority: WARNING
  tags: [filesystem]
- rule: Listen on New Port
  desc: Detection a new port is listening
  condition:
    evt.type = listen
  output: >
    A new port is open to listen (port=%fd.sport ip=%fd.sip)
  priority: WARNING
  tags: [network]
